Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Edward E Adams was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 04/01/2016 and each month thereafter or penalty of 24 days jail, consecutive for non-payment.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Waukesha Police Dept. Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.
With Huber. Release for standard conditions. Sentence credit of 10 days were granted.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Perform Alcohol Assessment. 

Attend the Victim Impact Panel meeting on 03/02/2016 or serve penalty of 30 days Huber, consecutive for non-attendance.

Case 15CM2382 was dismissed and read in.

  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Edward E Adams in court with Attorney Nicholas Martinez.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #2 on 2nd amended criminal complaint.  Court finds Defendant guilty of Count #2 on 2nd amended criminal complaint.  Counts #4 & 5 are dismissed.  Counts #1 & 3 are dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Court discloses to parties that it just realized that it was prosecutor on a case that charged Defendant approximately 10 years ago.  Attorney Martinez discusses issue off the record with his client and they wish to proceed today.   Attorney Martinez makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:   HUBER:  60 days (10 days credit),  Huber with standard release conditions.  Defendant to report to Huber facility by 6:00 p.m. on 2/2/16

FINE: $1,229.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($250.00) and remainder due at rate of $50.00 per month commencing 4/1/16 or serve 24 days jail, consecutive, as penalty for non payment of fine)

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to Waukesha Police Department. 

DL REVOCATION:  14 months

IGNITION INTERLOCK:  12 months

Victim Impact Panel on:  3/2/16. Defendant to serve 30 days huber, consecutive, as penalty for failure to attend Victim Impact Panel.

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Defendant Edward E Adams in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Date remains as scheduled.  Bail remains as fixed.  Defendant released on his/her own recognizance.  Defendant to report to WCS within the next 24 hours.
Non compliance with WCS. Br. 4 only.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Defendant Edward E Adams in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Martinez enters not guilty plea to charges on Amended complaint on 15CM2229. Atty Martinez requests a date in 45 days to review case. Court quashes capias on 15CM2229 based on Defendant's appearance. Court addresses WCS letter. Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Non compliance with WCS. Br. 4 only.

Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.

Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Defendant allowed a free phone call to obtain bail.  Hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
